verse: He got back in the boat, crossed the sea, and returned to His own town.

When He got there, some men approached Him carrying a mat. On the mat was another man, a paralytic. The men evidently believed that Jesus could heal the paralytic, and Jesus saw their faith, how much faith they had in His authority and power.
Now some scribes and teachers of the law had been watching this whole scene.
Though they had only spoken in low whispers among themselves, Jesus knew their thoughts.
And the man did.
When the crowd saw this, they were amazed, even a little scared, and they praised God who had given humans the authority to do such miraculous things.
Later Jesus was walking along and He saw a man named Matthew sitting in the tax collector’s office.
Once when He ate a meal at home with His disciples, a whole host of tax collectors and other sinners joined them.
When the Pharisees saw this, they asked Jesus’ disciples,
And then some of the disciples of John came.
As He was saying these things, a certain official came before Jesus and knelt in front of Him.
Jesus got up, and He and His disciples went with the man.
But as they were heading to the man’s house, a woman who had been hemorrhaging and bleeding for 12 years—12 years!—crept up behind Jesus.
Jesus turned around and saw her.
Then Jesus went to the official’s house. He saw flute players and mourners.
But they obeyed Him and left the house, and once they were gone, Jesus went to the girl. When He took her hand, she opened her eyes and stood up.
When the crowds outside learned that the girl was indeed alive, they spread throughout the town and the surrounding country telling everyone what had happened.
Jesus left the official’s house. And as He was walking, two blind men began to follow Him.
Jesus went to their house, and the blind men sat in front of Him.
And they could see. Then Jesus spoke to them as He had spoken to the leper.
But when the men (who could now see) left, they told everyone in the area they met what had happened.
Later a man who was possessed by demons and could not talk was brought to Jesus.
Jesus drove out the demons, and the mute man spoke. The crowds were amazed.
Jesus went through many towns and villages. He taught in their synagogues. He preached the good news of the kingdom of God. He healed every disease and sickness.
Whenever crowds came to Him, He had compassion for them because they were so deeply distraught, malaised, and heart-broken. They seemed to Him like lost sheep without a shepherd.
Jesus understood what an awesome task was before Him, so He said to His disciples, “The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few.
Ask the Lord of the harvest to send more workers into His harvest field.”
